entry.title: Batman CAN'T be Non-Meta... He Isn't Is He?
entry.summary:
Author: NotSoHarmlessBatfam

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,447Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 266

Summary: Batman keeps getting "severe" injuries on missions but shrugs them off. After being insistent on being non-meta the JL start to worry. But that's just how Bruce is, he may be a cryptid, and sure injuries don't hurt him and he may also be immortal... but that doesn't mean he can't fake being non-meta, if they research too much into his kind then his children will be uncovered! But after centuries of being a cryptid he may or may not have forgotten how "average" non-meta's react and behave... at first they shrugged it off as Batman being... well Batman. But even Batman can't not react to some of these injuries... can he?

entry.title: The Dark Knight Before Christmas - A Superbat Year One AU
entry.summary:
Author: EllEmmeCe

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,067Chapters: 26/26Kudos: 48

Summary: Gotham is having a very strange Christmas. Bruce Wayne’s latest vigilante experiment, a horned shadowy figure the press has named “Krampus,” was supposed to terrify criminals. Instead, it has gone viral as Gotham’s new holiday mascot. Clark Kent, investigative reporter and part-time baker, is on the case. He is following Krampus’s trail of cookie crumbs (literally) while secretly moonlighting as “Super Santa” to fix Gotham’s holiday chaos. Between gingerbread turtle clues, a viral photo of Krampus tangled in Christmas lights, and Alfred’s endless commentary, Bruce is one bad cape snag away from losing his mind. Meanwhile, Clark is just trying to figure out if Gotham’s scariest new legend is a monster, a myth, or a very grumpy man who needs a hug. Deffo Crack!fic :P It is a holiday season full of crime, cookies, and questionable branding decisions.

entry.title: late dawns and early sunsets
entry.summary:
Author: beyondnic

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 51,254Chapters: 12/12Kudos: 263

Summary: It's about two hours later when Bruce starts to sneak away, accidentally waking Clark up. The room is silent and dark, a beautiful and peaceful darkness. Outside, Metropolis' night is no different, there's no intergalactic threat, no thugs out on the street, no Superman up on the sky, and no Batman lurking in the shadows either. Clark is too asleep to form a proper thought, so his immediate response to Bruce's escape attempt is to just place a steady hand on Bruce's bare hip, he gets closer and against his hair, he whispers: "Stay."Bruce knows Clark's not expecting him to, after all, he had never stayed before, he always managed to get away and run off to his bittersweet crime-ridden streets. And he knows Clark won't hold him hostage, it's an honest plea, a silent prayer, a vow of stability, a solemn compromise Bruce was unexpectedly willing to take.One word. Whispered. Only for him. "Okay."OrClark Kent and Bruce Wayne start dating and they try to juggle their secret identities and their personal lives.

entry.title: La Belle et La Rose
entry.summary:
Author: Matador

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,071Chapters: 6/15Kudos: 18

Summary: Riquewihr is a strange place, people say. So steep in magic, with a beast as it's Lord... Harley's never paid the rumours any heed. Not when there are for more pressing issues closer to home. That is, until she finds herself volunteering to take her father's place in the belly of the beast: his castle. Beyond haunted, it's everything like the rumours and nothing like them at all. But is there more to the castle and it's terrifying occupant? And what of that rose, locked in the tower, of whom the Beast is most possessive of? (A Beauty & the Beast retelling)

entry.title: Above the Sky, Beneath the Mask
entry.summary:
Author: xedou

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,860Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 2

Summary: A light, chaotic, and deliciously inevitable romance.Batman is still Batman, serious, rigid, and emotionally illiterate.Superman, vulnerable for the first time, feels more human than ever and far too curious about Gotham’s enigmatic vigilante.Without knowing each other’s true identities, their communication only spirals downward. Forced to work together amid investigations and growing tension, they risk saving the city or bruising their own pride. Meanwhile, Diana watches it all unfold, fully aware of the chemistry they stubbornly refuse to acknowledge.A story of secrets, controlled chaos, and a love that grows slowly, unintentionally, and completely unavoidable.

entry.title: Colors
entry.summary:
Author: ladyshipper06

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,836Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 49

Summary: “Why didn’t you tell me?” Bruce’s voice cuts him off. It’s low, rough, almost a whisper, but it carries something deeper than reproach. Clark knows it. His blue-gray eyes lock onto Clark’s, and for a moment the world seems to stop. His gaze is clear, cold, but not harsh. There’s no judgment. No anger. Just a quiet understanding. Clark looks down at the mug. He swallows and shakes his head, tormented. “I didn’t know,” he replies, his voice breaking. There’s exhaustion in his tone. What makes him tremble isn’t fear—it’s disappointment. Disappointment in himself. His expression, usually calm, looks lost, disoriented, as if every word Bruce speaks is stabbing him, even though he knows that isn’t his intent. Bruce watches him. There’s nothing in his eyes that suggests disbelief, but Clark can’t quite read him. The city’s night light spills in through the window, illuminating Bruce’s tired face, dark circles beneath his eyes. [...] What would have happened if Batman were present in the 2025 Superman movie?
